page.title: 08 THE COKELERS
page.content: In 1850{John William Sirgood}walked from Clapham to Loxwood with his wife and his hand cart to preach the Gospel.His fame spread as he preached. He was reputed to have remarkable powers as a faith healer and even to have raised someone from the dead. After opposition from the local churches{he decided to form his own {sect, named the Cokelers or the {Dependants}They set up the{Combination {Stores}in Loxwood and ran them on co-operative lines. The Stores have now been demolished. The Cokelers kept very strict rules and marriage was not encouraged. It is said that the name "Cokelers" came from their custom of serving cocoa after meetings. Few of the sect are still living. Those who are left live in "The Retreat" in Spy Lane, a building which has its own Chapel and burial ground.
